titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 513) to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to clarify when organizations described in section 527 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 must register as political committees, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 513) to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to clarify when organizations described in section 527 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 must register as political committees, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-404, by Mr. Dreier.

The bill shall be considered in the House. The amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on House Administration now printed in the bill, modified by the amendment printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution, shall be considered as adopted.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 159.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 755.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 226 - 198 (Roll no. 85).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 223 - 199 (Roll no. 86).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 513 (527 Reform Act of 2005).
